sentences.en: British newspapers no longer feel they must treat the royal family with discretion.
sentences.cn: 英国报界不再觉得他们非得审慎对待王室不可了。

sentences.en: Discretion in speech is more than eloquence.
sentences.cn: 出言慎重胜过口若悬河.

sentences.en: Discretion is not Jeremy's strong point.
sentences.cn: 小心谨慎不是杰里米的强项。

sentences.en: Discretion is the better part of valour.
He appreciated his discretion and his fidelity.
sentences.cn: 他欣赏他的谨慎和忠诚。

sentences.en: I'll leave it up to you to use your discretion .
sentences.cn: 我把这件事留给你自己斟酌决定。

sentences.en: Larsson sometimes joined in the fun, but with more discretion.
sentences.cn: 拉森有时会和大家一起玩乐，但是显得更加矜持。

sentences.en: Promotions are left to the discretion of the supervisor.
School governors have the discretion to allow parents to withdraw pupils in exceptional circumstances.
sentences.cn: 督学可以酌情允许父母在特殊情况下让学生退学。

sentences.en: This case should be settled at the discretion of the court.
This shouldn't be left entirely to his discretion.
sentences.cn: 这事不能任凭他一人决定.

sentences.en: Visits are at the discretion of the owners.
sentences.cn: 是否接受参观访问由业主决定。

sentences.en: We may vary the limit at our discretion and will notify you of any change.
sentences.cn: 我们可能会斟酌改变限额，有任何变动将通知您。

sentences.en: Where there are no service charges added to the bill, tip at your discretion.
sentences.cn: 凡账单上没收服务费的，是否付小费由你自己决定。

sentences.en: You must show discretion in choosing your friend.
Your secret's safe with him, and he's the soul of discretion.
sentences.cn: 他会严守你的秘密, 他是谨慎的化身.

words.tran_cn: 任意的（等于discretionary）；自由决定的
自由裁量权；谨慎；判断力；判定；考虑周到

phrases.phrase: discretion is the better part of valour

trans.tran_cn: 慎重，考虑周到，判断力，辨别力，自行决定的自由
trans.tran_en: the ability to deal with situations in a way that does not offend, upset, or embarrass people or tell any of their secrets
